name: src/headers.js
src/http.js
Http
description: An HTTP client.

params.name: options
params.description: A hash of settings for this client.

unknown.tagValue:
{String|Http} - If url is specified, updates the default baseUrl
for all requests created with this client, and returns the client instance.
If value is ommitted, returns the current baseUrl.

params.name: url
params.description:
the base URL applied by default to all
requests from this client.

return.description:
If url is specified, updates the default baseUrl
for all requests created with this client, and returns the client instance.
If value is ommitted, returns the current baseUrl.

unknown.tagValue:
{Number|Http} - If value is specified, updates the default request
timeout for all requests created with this client, and returns the client
instance.  If value is ommitted, returns the current timeout value.

params.name: value
params.description: The request timeout in milliseconds

return.description:
If value is specified, updates the default request
timeout for all requests created with this client, and returns the client
instance.  If value is ommitted, returns the current timeout value.

unknown.tagValue:
{String|Http} - If the value is specified, sets the name of the XSRF Cookie
and returns the current Http.  If value is ommitted, returns the current name.

params.name: value
params.description: The name of the XSRF cookie

return.description:
If the value is specified, sets the name of the XSRF Cookie
and returns the current Http.  If value is ommitted, returns the current name.

unknown.tagValue:
{String|Http} - If the value is specified, sets the name of the XSRF Header
and returns the current Http.  If value is ommitted, returns the current name.

params.name: value
params.description: The name of the XSRF header

return.description:
If the value is specified, sets the name of the XSRF Header
and returns the current Http.  If value is ommitted, returns the current name.

unknown.tagValue:
{Boolean|Http} - If the value is specified, sets the withCredentials flag
and returns the current Http.  If value is ommitted, returns the current
value of the flag.

params.name: value
params.description:
Flag indicating whether cross-site AccessControl
requests should be made using cookies, authorization headers, or TLS client
certificates.  More detail: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/XMLHttpRequest/withCredentials

return.description:
If the value is specified, sets the withCredentials flag
and returns the current Http.  If value is ommitted, returns the current
value of the flag.

unknown.tagValue:
{String|Http} - If the value is specified, sets the username and returns
the current Http.  If value is ommitted, returns the current username.

params.name: value
params.description: Basic auth username

return.description:
If the value is specified, sets the username and returns
the current Http.  If value is ommitted, returns the current username.

unknown.tagValue:
{String|Http} - If the value is specified, sets the password and returns
the current Http.  If value is ommitted, returns the current password.

params.name: value
params.description: Basic auth password

return.description:
If the value is specified, sets the password and returns
the current Http.  If value is ommitted, returns the current password.

unknown.tagValue:
{Interceptor[]|Http} - If values is specified, replaces the default
interceptors for all requests from this client, and returns the client
instance.  If values is ommitted, returns the current array of
interceptors.

params.name: values
params.description: An array of interceptors.

return.description:
If values is specified, replaces the default
interceptors for all requests from this client, and returns the client
instance.  If values is ommitted, returns the current array of
interceptors.

params.name: interceptor
params.description:
Add the interceptor to the end of the
chain of interceptors.

return.description: The current client instance.

unknown.tagValue: {Http} - The current client instance.

params.name: interceptor
params.description: Remove the interceptor from the chain of interceptors.

return.description: The current client instance.

Interceptor
description: Base class to be inherited by Interceptors

name: request
description: Transforms (or fails) an outgoing request.

params.name: request
params.description: The request to be processed

params.name: accept
params.description: called on success to process a (potentially transformed) {@link Request}

params.name: reject
params.description: called on failure to pass an error

name: requestError
description: Try to recover from a request error so processing can resume.

params.name: error
params.description: The error to be processed

params.name: accept
params.description: called on success if we were able to recover

params.name: reject
params.description: called on failure to pass an error

params.description: The response to be processed

params.description: called on success to process a (potentially transformed) {@link Response}

params.name: reject
params.description: called on failure to pass an error

src/interceptors/method-override.js
MethodOverride
description:
If the HTTP verb is not one understood by Browsers, change the verb
to a POST and send the X-HTTP-Method-Override header with the original
method.  This should generally be understood by the routers of most
server backends.

unknown.tagValue:
Provider-implementation for browser-based clients.  Providers are simply
functions that take in a {@link Request} and return an RxJS Observable
that eventually contains the {@link Response}.
{Observable<Response>}

src/request-interceptor-chain.js
RequestInterceptorChain
description: Runs the request interceptors, and requestError interceptors if necessary.

params.name: interceptors
params.description: The array of interceptors to be run

params.name: accept
params.description:
Callback that is invoked with the final request
object after all interceptors have run successfully.

params.name: reject
params.description:
Callback that is invoked with an error object
if all of the interceptors fail to recover from an error.

name: src/request.js
Request
description: A Request should only ever be created by an instance of {@link Http}

params.name: config
params.description: Override default settings for this Request only.

params.name: value
params.description: The HTTP method for this request

name: headers
examples:
request.headers() // returns { "foo": "bar" }
If only name is specified, and name is a string - returns the value for the key in the headers hash.

request.headers("foo") // returns "bar"
If only name is specified, and name is an object - replaces the entire headers hash
and returns the current Request.

request.headers({ "foo": "bar", "baz": 1 })
If name and value are specified - sets the value of name in the headers hash
and returns the current Request.

unknown.tagValue:
{Object|String|Request} -
If no parameters are specified - returns a copy of the entire headers hash.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the header

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the header

return.description: If no parameters are specified - returns a copy of the entire headers hash.

name: contentType
description: Convenience method for getting/setting the Content-Type header.

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the Content-Type header

name: responseType
description: XHRProvider only - sets the responseType field of the {@link XMLHttpRequest}

params.name: value
params.description: The expected responseType

params.name: value
params.description: The request timeout in milliseconds

params.description: The serializer for the body

params.description: The body for this request

name: src/response-interceptor-chain.js
ResponseInterceptorChain
description: Runs the response interceptors, and responseError interceptors if necessary.

params.name: interceptors
params.description: The array of interceptors to be run

params.name: accept
params.description:
Callback that is invoked with the final response
object after all interceptors have run successfully.

params.name: reject
params.description:
Callback that is invoked with an error object

name: src/response.js
Response
description: Immutable response container.  Should only be created by executing a {@link Request}.

params.name: body
params.description: An Observable representing the body/entity of the response

params.name: uploadProgress
params.description: An Observable representing a stream of all upload progress events

params.name: downloadProgress
params.description: An Observable representing a stram of all download progress events

unknown.tagValue: {Observable<Object>} - an Observable stream of upload progress events

return.description: an Observable stream of upload progress events

unknown.tagValue: {Observable<Object>} - an Observable stream of download progress events

return.description: an Observable stream of download progress events

unknown.tagValue: {Observable<String>} - An Observable stream of the response body/entity contents

return.description: An Observable stream of the response body/entity contents

unknown.tagValue: {Number} - The HTTP status code of the response

return.description: The HTTP status code of the response

unknown.tagValue: {String} - The status text of the response

return.description: The status text of the response

unknown.tagValue:
{String|Object} - If name is given, returns the value of the
header with the given name.  Otherwise, returns the hash containing
all of the response headers

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the header to lookup

return.description:
If name is given, returns the value of the
header with the given name.  Otherwise, returns the hash containing
all of the response headers

unknown.tagValue:
{Boolean} - Determines if this is a chunked response.  A chunked
response will send each chunk through the {@link body} stream.  A non-chunked
response will only push the final result through the stream.

return.description:
Determines if this is a chunked response.  A chunked
response will send each chunk through the {@link body} stream.  A non-chunked
response will only push the final result through the stream.

name: query
examples:
request.query() // returns { "foo": "bar" }
If only name is specified, and name is a string - returns the value for the key in the query hash.

request.query("foo") // returns "bar"
If only name is specified, and name is an object - replaces the entire query hash
and returns the current Request.

request.query({ "foo": "bar", "baz": 1 }).execute()
If name and value are specified - sets the value of name in the query hash
and returns the current Request.

unknown.tagValue:
{Object|String|Request} -
If no parameters are specified - returns a copy of the entire query hash.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the query-string parameter

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the query-string parameter

return.description: If no parameters are specified - returns a copy of the entire query hash.

unknown.tagValue:
{String} - returns basic auth credentials in the format
user:password, if both user and password are set.

return.description:
returns basic auth credentials in the format
user:password, if both user and password are set.

unknown.tagValue: {String} - returns the authority portion of the url ([protocol]://[userInfo@]host[:port])

return.description: returns the authority portion of the url ([protocol]://[userInfo@]host[:port])

unknown.tagValue: {String} - returns the path portion of the url

return.description: returns the path portion of the url

unknown.tagValue:
{Url} - returns a copy of this {@link Url} with the directory,
file, gragment, path, and query portions from taken from other.  If
any of those properties do not exist in other, they will be removed
from the copy.

params.name: other
params.description: the {@link Url} to merge into this one

return.description:
returns a copy of this {@link Url} with the directory,
file, gragment, path, and query portions from taken from other.  If
any of those properties do not exist in other, they will be removed
from the copy.

unknown.tagValue: {String}

a function that can customize
